ab.note: The edition by Carlo Conti Rossini on p.202 contains በ፭፪ወ፭ instead of በ፭፻ወ፭, which seems to be a simple type-error, for non of the witnesses contain this date and it is not marked in the apparatus. It is proved by the date, 1321, which Carlo Conti Rossini must have counted from በ፭፻ወ፭. Further, it reads ውስተ፡ ሀገሩ፡ ዘመጣዕ, while it is ውስተ፡ ሀገሩ in the manuscript, ወአልህምትሂ፡ ፲፪ instead of ወአልህምትሂ፡ ፲፻,ሰራዌልየ instead of ስራዌልየ and እሳየ instead of አሣእንየ.

ab.seg: To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit.
in 505 year of mercy, I, king ʿAmda Ṣǝyon, granted ’abbā Maṭā‘ of ’Aham so that he would beseech a reward for me in the Heavenly Kingdom,

182 [pieces] of gold, two crosses of gold and one dish of gold and one chalice of gold, one dish of silver and one chalice of silver, 103 rich vestments to the church of Maṭā‘ and to the holy ones 40 fine cloths, and 30 rich vestments and 1000 cows to the other churches in his land. And after all, I gave my own golden robe and my weapon and my two pans taken from my hip, and my pair of shoes from my feet. And all this I gave, knowing that the wealth of this world will pass, so that beloved Maṭā‘ would beseech a reward for me the Heavenly Kingdom, forever and ever, Amen.
ab.note: As Roger Schneider's translator relied on the edited text, his translation reads as "In the year of Mercy 525 year'; not 'in his land' but 'inside the land of Maṭā‘'; '12 cows' instead of 1000; ሰራዌልየ remains untranslated. Then, as was mentioned, I made a choice for as 'would beseech a reward for me for me', while Roger Scheider's translator offers 'may be my garantor'.

ወለንጉሥነ፡ ዐምደ፡ ጽዮን፡ ዘአዕበዮ፡ እምነገሥተ፡ ምድር፡ ያኑኅ፡ መዋዕሊሁ፡ በዲበ፡ ምድር፡ ወይረስዮ፡ እግዚኣብሔ፡ ሥሩዐ፡ ከመ፡ ወርኅ፡ ወብሩሀ፡ ከመ፡ ፀሓይ፡ ወይዕቀብ፡ አንስትያሁ፡ ወደቂቁ፡ ወደቂቀ፡ ደቂቁ፡ ወዓዲ፡ ያድኅኖሙ፡ ለሰራዊቱ፡ እምስረተ፡ ኀጽ፡ ወውግረተ፡ እብን። ወያግርር፡
ጸሮ፡ ወጻላእቶ፡ በዕለተ፡ ሞቱሂ፡ ይኈልቆ፡ ምስለ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ ወሰማዕት፡ ምስለ፡ እለ፡ አስመርዎ፡ ለእግዚኣብሔር፡ ምስለ፡ ዳዊት፡ ወቈስጠንጢኖስ፡ ወአኖርዮስ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን።

And for our King ʿAmda Ṣǝyon, who was made the greatest among the kings on the earth, may God extend his days on the earth and may God make him set firmly as the Moon and splendid as the Sun and may He protect his wives and his children and children of his children and may He save his army from the flying dart and from throwinging of a stone. And may He subdue his enemy and his adversaries. And on the day of his death, may He count him among the saints and martyrs and among those who pleased God, with Dawit and Qwosṭanṭinos and ʾAnoryos, for ever and ever, Amen. Translation: What I translate as 'who was made the greatest among the kings on the earch', Roger Schneider's translator offers 'whom he has elevated above the kings of the earch'; for my 'splendid as the Sun' he offers 'bright as the Sun'; for my 'may He protect his wives...' he offers 'may he keep his wives'; for my 'may He save his army from the flying dart' he offers 'may he protect his armies from the piercieng of arrows'; for my 'from throwinging of a stone' he offers 'from being crushed by stones'; for my 'those who pleased God' he offers 'among those who exalted God'.
ወአንትሙሂ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ እለ፡ ሀለውክሙ፡ ውስተ፡ መካነ፡ መጣዕ፡ ጸልዩ፡ ለ ንጉሥ፡ ዐምደ፡ ጽዮን፡ ሰርከ፡ ወነግሀ፡ ሌሊት፡ ወምዐልተ፡ ቀትረ፡ ወሰዐተ፡ በውስተ፡ ቊርባንሂ፡ ወበውስተ፡ ማኅበርሂ፡ ወኀበ፡ ተጋባእክሙሂ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። ።

And you, the holy ones, those who dwells in the place of Maṭāʿ, pray for the King ʿAmda Ṣǝyon, at the evenings and at the daybreak, at time of noons, and at the hour of Qwǝrbān and during the māḫbar and by assembling, forever and ever, Amen.

ab.seg: To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit.

In the 507th year of Mercy, I,Bǝlen Sabā,the lady of Biḥat,wife of ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon,the king,because of the love to Maṭāʿ, so that he would beseech a reward for me in the Heavenly Kingdom, while I shall stay naked infront of the Heavenly King, Galabāand ʾƎnqarʿo, I gave this gwǝlt to blessed Maṭāʿ, my beloved, which should not penestrate neither a horse nor a lion, neither a sǝyum of Dabra Māʿǝṣo nor a sǝyum of Zaredā, neither an appointed one, nor the deposed one, neither the one who reigns nor who is agitated, neither
the spokesman of nǝguś, nor children of the palace. And if there is anyone who frauds or violates this gwǝlt, which I granted to ʾabbā Maṭāʿ of ʾAham, while the kingʿĀmda Ṣǝyonand while the sǝyum of ʾƎntartā Bǝlen Sabā the lady of Biḥat and while māʾǝkala baḥǝr Samāy, and while sǝyum of Dabra Māʿǝṣo Maṭre ʾEgziʾ, and while sǝyum of Zaredā Zarʾa Dāwit, and while ʿaqābe saʿata Maṭāʿ Gabra Krǝstos. I gave this, knowing that the whole world will pass, and I have heard the word of Ecclesiastes saying, 'Vanity, all is vanity, unless one prepares his provisions beforehead alive'. And I gave to Maṭā‘ and to the holy ones 150 cows and linen vestments and I loaded offerings that I brought from ʾAmḥarā. If there will be anyone who usurps this gwǝlt which I gave for offering and for commemoration of my beloved Maṭāʿ, may he be excommunicated by the mouth of the 15 prophets and by the mouth of 12 Apostles, by the mouth of 318 righteous of faith, by the mouth of Ṗeṭros liqa ṗāṗāsāt, by the prayer of the blessed Maṭāʿ and by the mouth of the Father. And the Son and the Holy Spirit may he be excommunicated in this world
and in the world that comes. This [transgression] can not be released through fasting or prayer, begging or bows for ages of ages, Amen. I offered this gwǝlt and did all this as my lord King ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon ordered me, saying, 'Go, come to Maṭāʿof ʾAham and do the will of the blessed Maṭāʿ, my beloved. And say: "Do not abandon, o Lord, my Lord ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon in the days of his youth"'. So I came and cried, wept and rolled myself on the grave of Maṭāʿ as ordered me my lord ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon. 'Do for him, o Lord, according to the desire of his heart, saying "Give ʾƎnqarʿo and Galabā, so that God give me in return for this little a lot in the Heavenly Kingdom, amen." May God give hime in return of a litle - great, amen. May God give him in return for that on the earth - that on the heaven, amen. In return for what ages - what does not age, amen. In return perished - what does not perish, amen. And may He prolong his days on the earth, amen. And may He subdue his rival
and his enemies, amen. And may he forgive his sins and obliterate the book of his debts, amen. May God give him wisdom as to Solomon, amen. May God give him benevolence as to Dāwit, amen. May God give him patience as to ʾƎyob, amen. May God give him victory as to ʾIyāsu, amen.
ab.note: Roger Schneider's translator, as he used the edited text by Conti Rossini, translated በ፭፻፡ ወ፯፡ ዓመተ፡ ምሕረት, what I translate as 'In the 507th year of Mercy' as 'In the Year of Mercy 506.' in ስዩመ፡ ዘሬዳ the translator interprets ዘ as an element to express a genitive case relationship: thus, what I translate as 'sǝyum of Zaredā Zarʾa Dāwit' he translates as 'the governor of Redā'. ኢትንሥኦ፡ እግዚኦ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ ውርዙቱ፡ ለእግዚእየ፡ ዐምደ፡ ጽዮን, which I translate as 'Do not abandon, o Lord, my Lord ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon in the days of his youth' he translates as 'Do not abandor my lord ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon in the days of his youth'. There are other cases, which should be rather discussed for my choice is dubious: ከመ፡ ይትወኀሰኒ, which I tranlate as 'would beseech a reward for me', he translates as 'may be my guarantor'; ዘኢይበኦ, which I translate as 'should not penestrate' he translates more literally (may be correctly)'shall enter'; ኢዘነገሠ፡ ወኢዘአንገስገሰ, which I translate as 'neither the one who reigns nor who is agitated' he translates as 'neither the one who is made king nor the one who made king'; ቃል፡ ነጋሲ፡ ወኢደቀ፡ ጽርኅ, which I translate as 'neither the spokesman of nǝguś, nor children of the palace' he translates as 'neither the proxy of the king nor the pages (I am not sure about my interpretation for it makes little sense for me) of the palace'; ወለእመቦ፡ ዘተአገለ, which I traslate as 'if there is anyone who frauds' he translates as 'if there be anyone who transgresses'; ወመባእሂ፡ ጽዒንየ፡ ዘአውረድኩ፡ በአምኀራ, which I translates as ' I loaded offerings that I brought from ʾAmḥarā' he translates as 'and offerings which I brought down through Amhara on pack animals (marked with a question-mark by a translator himself)'; ዘኢይትፈታሕ, which I translate as 'This [transgression] can not be released' he translates as 'in such a way that it cannot be revoked';

div.ab:
And for this Bǝlen Sabā the lady of Biḥat, may God give her love with her husbandʿĀmda Ṣǝyon, who fullfilled his will with her authority, as a good blessed servant that pleases his lord by his service, like this she did good by her service. May God give her good reward, amen. May God give her many days in joy, which do not have sadness, with her husbandʿĀmda Ṣǝyon,amen. And on the day of their summons may God announce them the word of joy saying: 'Come to me blessed by Father, inherit the kingdom, which was prepared for you from before the world, amen.' And may He bless their children, amen and may He multiply their seed like the stars of
heaven and like the sand of the sea, amen and amen. And let all people say 'Amen and amen'.
div.note: For ወለይእቲኒ, which I translate as 'And for this', Roger Schneider's translator has 'And to her'; በከመ፡ ገብር፡ ብፁዕ፡ ኄር፡ ዘያስተፈሥሕ፡ እግዚኡ, which I translate as 'as a good blessed servant that pleases his lord' he translates as 'like a praiseworthy, diligent slave who pleases his master'; በመልእክታ I translate as 'by her service', while he offers 'through her errand'; እምቅድመ፡ ዓለም I translate as 'from before the world', he offers 'from the foundation of the world'.

div.ab: ወኵልክሙ፡ እለ፡ አንበብክሙ፡ ጸልዩ፡ ለንጉሥ፡ ዐምደ፡ ጽዮን፡ ወለንግሥት፡ ብሌን፡ ሰባ፡ ከመ፡ ይምሐሮሙ፡ እግዚኣብሔር፡ በሰማይ፡ ወበምድር፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ ወአሜን።
div.note: Conti Rossini reads ብሌን፡ ሰባ as ብሌን፡ ሳባ. Transcription by Roger Schneider omits በሰማይ.

div.ab: And all you who read [it], pray for our king ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon and for our quenn Bǝlen Sabā, so that God show mercy on them in heaven and on earth forever and ever, amen and amen.

በአኰቴተ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ አነ፡ ዐምደ፡ ጽዮን፡ ወሀብኩ፡ አንፈ፡ በዐት፡ ማርያም፡ ዘሰዐጋ፡ ሕፄን፡ ይግበሩ፡ ሎቱ፡ ተዝካሩ፡ ለመጣዕ፡ ወሊተሂ፡ ከመ፡ ትዘከረኒ፡ እግዚእትየ፡ ማርያም፡ በጸሎታ፡ በኀበ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ወዘአጐለትኩ፡ በ፭የወ፯፡ ዓመተ፡ ምሕረት፡ አነ፡ ዓምደ፡ ጽዮን፡ እንዘ፡ ሥይምተ፡ እንትርታ፡ ብሌን፡ ሰብአ፡ እንዘ፡ መእከለ፡ ባሕር፡ ሰማይ፡ ወእንዘ፡ አውፋሪ፡ ድግና፡ እመቦ፡ ዘተሐየለ፡ እማርያም፡ ዘሰዐጋ፡ አንፈ፡ በዓት፡ ሕፄን፡ ዘወሀብኩ፡ አነ፡ ዐምደ፡ ጽዮን፡ እመቦ፡ ዘተሐየሎ፡ ወዘተአገሎ፡ እመሂ፡ ማእከለ፡ ባሕር፡ ወእመሂ፡ ሥዩመ፡ እንትርታ፡ ወእመሂ፡ አውፋሪ፡ ወእመሂ፡ ሥዩም፡ አጽቢ፡ እመሂ፡ ኅዱግ፡ ወቃል፡ ነጋሢ፡ ውጉዛን፡ ይኩኑ፡ አሜን፡ በአፈ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ አሜን፡ በአፈ፡ ፫፻፡ ፲ወ፰፡ ርቱዓነ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ አሜን። ወበማርያም፡ ወላዲ
ተ፡ አምላክ፡ ውጉዛነ፡ ለይኩኑ፡ አሜን።
div.note: Conti Rossini reads ሥይምተ as ሥይመተ, ዘተሐየለ as ዘተሐየሎ, ወዘተአገሎ as ወዘተአገቦ, ቃል፡ ነጋሢ as ቃለ፡ ነጋሢ. Both Conti Rossini and Roger Schneider read my መእከለ፡ ባሕር፡ ሰማይ as መእከለ፡ ባሕር፡ ስማይ. Roger Schneider did three notes not the text: 1.(ሕፄን) The two letters ፄን፡ are smaller and seem to have been written over an erasure. 2.(ለመጣዕ) መጣ has been written later over an erasure. 3.([አንፈ፡ በዓት]፡ ሕ[ፄን፡ ])The passages between brackets have been written over an erasure, by a later hand.

div.ab:
To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit. I, ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon granted ʾAnfa Baʿat [to] Māryām za-Saʿagā Ḥǝṣen so that they celebrate the commemoration of Maṭāʿ and for me, so that my Lady Mary remember me in her prayer to her beloved Son. It was in 507 year of Mercy that I granted gwǝlt, I, ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon, while sǝyǝmt of ʾƎntǝrtāBǝlen Sabā, whilemaʾǝkala bāḥrSamāy, and while ʾawfāri Dǝgnā. If there is anyone who usurps from Māryām za-Saʿagā ʾAnfa Baʿat Ḥǝṣen, which I,ʿĀmda Ṣǝyongranted, if there is anyone who violates or defraudes it, if even maʾǝkala bāḥr or sǝyum of ʾƎntǝrtā, if even ʾawfāri or sǝyum of ʾAṣbi, if even a deputy or a spokesman of nǝgus, may they be excommunicated, amen, by the mouth of Ṗeṭros liqa ṗāṗāsāt, amen; by the mouth of 318 righteous of faith, amen. And by Māryām, bearer of
Lord, may they be excommunicated, amen.
div.note: ወሀብኩ I translate as 'I granted', while Roger Schneider's translator has it as 'I have given'; ይግበሩ፡ ሎቱ፡ ተዝካሩ I translate as 'they celebrate the commemoration', while he offers 'they [the priests] may celebrate the commemoration'; እንዘ፡ መእከለ፡ ባሕር፡ ሰማይ, which I interprete as 'whilemaʾǝkala bāḥrSamāy', he misinterpreted as '[that of] Maʾǝkala Bāḥr, Semay'; ወዘተአገለ I translate as 'defraudes it', while he has 'transgresses', marking Conti Rossini's 'ወዘተአገቦ' in square brakets with a question mark; እመሂ፡ ማእከለ፡ ባሕር, which I translate as 'if even maʾǝkala bāḥr', he has misinterpreted again into 'be it the [governor of] Maʾǝkala Bāḥr'; ወቃል፡ ነጋሢ, which I translate as 'a spokesman of nǝgus', he translates as 'a king's proxy'.

div.ab: በአኰቴተ፡ አብ፡ ወወልደ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ አግባእኩ፡ አነ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ አቡሁ፡ በአፈ፡ ዐምደ፡ ጽዮን፡ ንጉሥ፡ ተርካ፡ ዘቀዳሚ፡ ምድሮሙ፡ ለቅዱሳን፡ እለ፡ ቤተ፡ መጣዕ፡ እንዘ፡ ዐቃቤ፡ ሰዐት፡ ዕቅባ፡ እግዚእ፡ ወእመ፡ ቦ፡ ዘተኀየሎሙ፡ ወዘተአገሎሙ፡ ለቅዱሳን፡ ይእቲ፡ ምድር፡ በጽንፋ፡ ወበቀልቀላ፡ ለተርካ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ለይኩን፡ በቅድመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ በአ ፈ፡ ፫፻፡ ፲ወ፰፡ ርቱዐነ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ወበአፈ፡ ፲ወ፭፡ ነቢያት፡ ወበአፈ፡ ፲ወ፪፡ ሐዋርያት፡ ወበአፈ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ጳጳሳት፡ ዘኢይትፈታሕ፡ በጾም፡ ወበጸሎት፡ በስኢል፡ ወበሰጊድ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ ወአሜን፡ ለይኩን፡ ለይኩን። ወእመቦ፡ ዘደምሰሳ፡ ወዘቀደዳ፡ በጽልሑት፡ ከማሁ፡ ለይኩን፡ ውጉዘ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን። በቅድመ፡ አብ Conti Rossini has as በአፈ፡ አብ. Roger Schneider had one comment to this text: 1.ዐቃቤ፡ ሰዓት has been erased, but the letters are still faintly discernible. The copy B still has it.

To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit. I, Krǝstos ʾAbuhu,restored, by the mouth ofKing ʿĀmda Ṣǝyon, Tarkā, previously the land of the holy ones of the church of Maṭāʿ, while ʿaqābe saʿat ʿƎqbā ʾƎgziʾ. And if there is anyone who would violate or pervert from the holy ones this land, [even] on the borders or cliffs of Tarkā, may he be excommunicated in front of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit by the mouth of 318 righteous in faith and by the mouth of 15 prophets and by the mouth of 12 apostles and by the mouth of Ṗeṭros liqa ṗāṗāsāt, that will not be forgiven through fasting or prayer, through vows or bows unto the ages of ages, amen and amen. May it be so, may it be so. And if there is anyone who erase it or who scratch it in deceit, may he be likewise excommunicated unto the ages of ages, amen. Roger Schneider's translator offers 'have brough in' for አግባእኩ, which I translate as 'restored'; ወእመ፡ ቦ፡ ዘተኀየሎሙ፡ ወዘተአገሎሙ he has as 'if there is anyone who snaches or usurps', which I translate as 'would violate or pervert'; በጽንፋ፡ ወበቀልቀላ he translates as 'on the edges and slopes', while I translate as 'on the borders or cliffs'; በቅድመ፡ አብ, which I translate as 'in front of the Father', he has as 'by the mouth of the Father', which shows that he was translating from Conti Rossini's edition. ዘኢይትፈታሕ, which I translates as 'that will not be forgiven', he translates as 'which [excommunication] will not be revoked'; ወእመቦ፡ ዘደምሰሳ፡ ወዘቀደዳ፡ በጽልሑት I translate as 'if there is anyone who erase it or who scratch it in deceit', while he translates it as 'if there is anyone who with a bad intention erases or tears it'.

በአኰቴተ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ: ጸሐፍነ፡ ኀቢረነ፡ ወሠሚረነ፡ ተጋቢአነ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ ዐቃቤ፡ ሰዓት፡ ዘቤተ፡ መጣዕ፡ ከመ፡ ኢያውፅኡ፡ አልባሰ፡ ዘመጣዕ፡ ኢዐቢየ፡ ወኢንኡሰ፡ ወኢየሀቡ፡ ለቤተ፡
መጣዕ፡ ወለእመቦ፡ ዘወሀበ፡ ለመርዓ፡ እምነ፡ አልባስ፡ ዘአባ፡ መጣዕ፡ እመሂ፡ ፩ ወእመሂ፡ ቀይሰ፡ ገበዝ፡ ወእመሂ፡ መነኮሳት፡ እመሂ፡ ዓቢይ፡ ወእመሂ፡ ንኡስ፡ እመሂ፡ ሥዩም፡ ወእመሂ፡ ሥዑር፡ ለእመቦ፡ ዘአውፅአ፡ በቅድመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ ወአሜን፡ ለይኩን፡ ለይኩን፡ አሜን።

በአኰቴተ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ: ዘወሀቡ፡ ቀደምት፡ ተርከ፡ ለአቡነ፡ ሊባኖስ፡ ወአነሂ፡ ተንሥአ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ ወሀብኩ፡ ወአግባእኩ፡ ዘተገፍዐ፡ ተርከ፡ አነ፡ ከመ፡ ይትወሐሠኒ፡ መጣዕ፡ በመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፡ ከመ፡ ይግበሩ፡ ተዝካርየ፡ ደቂቀ፡ መካን፡ ወኢይርስዑኒ፡ በጊዜ፡ ጸሎት፡ ሰሚዕየ፡ ዘይቤ፡ ቃለ፡ ሰሎሞን፡ መክብብ፡ ከንቱ፡ ከንቱ፡ ለዓለም፡ ንብረ ቱ፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘገብረ፡ ሥንቁ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ ሕይወቱ፡ የሀቦ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ለተንሥአ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ መንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፡ ህየንተ፡ ኅዳጥ፡ ብዙኅ፡ አሜን፡ የሀቦ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ህየንተ፡ ንስቲት፡ ዓቢይ፡ የሀቦ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ህየንተ፡ ዘበ፡ ምድር፡ ዘበ፡ ሰማያት፡ ወያኑኅ፡ መዋዕሊሁ፡ በዲበ፡ ምድር፡ ወያግርር፡ ፀሮ፡ ወጸላእቶ፡ አሜን። ወይስረይ፡ ኃጢአቱ፡ ወይደምሰስ፡ መጽሐ ፈ፡ ዕዳሁ፡ አሜን። ወለእመቦ፡ ዘሄዳ፡ ወዘተአገላ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ለይኩን፡ ዘኢይትፈታሕ፡ በጾም፡ ወበጸሎት፡ በአፉሁ፡ ለአቡነ፡ መጣዕ፡ አሜን። Roger Schneider has two notes to this document, he comments two cases (also noted by Conti Rossini as 'illeggibile') which I noted as 'effaced': 1.One line erased. 2. One of the lines erased. The first letter seems to be ለ, the third perhaps ፈ.

To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit. I, Tansʾa Krǝstos, , restored the vexed Tarka, that Tarka they previously granted to our Father Libānos, so that Maṭāʿ would beseech a reward for me the Heavenly Kingdom, so that the children of this place would celebrate my tǝzkār and would not forget me during the time of their prayers, for I have heard the word of Solomon from the Book of Ecclesiastes, [saying]: 'Vanity, all is vanity, unless one prepares his provisions beforehead alive'. May God give Tansʾa Krǝstos Heavenly Kingdom, in return for this little a lot, amen. May God give hime in return of a litle - great. May God give him in return for that on the earth - that on the heaven. And may He prolong his days on the earth. And may He subdue his rival and his enemies, amen. And may He forgive his sins and obliterate the book of his debts, amen. And if there is anyone who confiscates or violates it, may he be excommunicated, in such a way that it can not be released through fasting or prayer, by the mouth of our Father Maṭā‘, amen.

div.ab: I, Yǝsmǝka ʾƎgziʾ, sǝyum of Ḫamāsen, to ʾAbbā Maṭāʿ of ʾAham, healer of the sick ones, ኀበ፡ ተቀብረ፡ አዕጽምቲሁ፡ ፭፡ ነፍሰ፡ ሰብእ፡ ገድቦ and his wife and his children, so that he would beseech a reward for me the Heavenly Kingdom and prolong my days on the earth and protect my soul and my body, with my wifes and children and my relatives. And previously I granted, for I have heard the word of Ecclesiastes, saying: 'Vanity, all is vanity, unless one does the good alive'. And in Agama rectified the gwǝlt.

div.ab: And while two were united, KingLālibālāandhis wifeMasqal Kǝbrabaʾalt of Biḥat, so that it become salvation of their souls in the Heavenly Kingdom, and for my wife may He associate her with saint women, with Sārā and Salome, with Ḥānnā and Sofiā and may He not remember her sins and may the book of her transgressions be obliterated, Amen and Amen. Let it be, let it be. And while the greats ofBǝgwǝna were qālaṗāsAbt, pāpāsʾabunaGiyorgis andʾeṗisqoṗos Ḫarayo, ʿāqābe saʿāt MaṭāʿYǝrdǝʾanna Krǝstos, liqa ziyāqonātSawǝn, qaysa gabaz ṢǝyonʾAb Yǝkun, malḥǝzoYǝtbārak, qas ḥaṣāniZa-ʾAdonāya, ṣawar nārge ma’āsareKrǝstos Bǝna, ṣaḥaf lāmSǝbḥat, ḥasgwāYǝ‘ǝqabanna, mā’ǝkala bāḥrʾAsgada, ‘aqā ṣanṣanBārā Ṣeyon, ‘aqāb dage māsarayYǝmḥaranna, liqa ’aqaytātZara Wǝdǝm, while liqa kenotZa-ʾAmalāy and while liqa ḫǝdārYāmo, liqa masanqoWalda Bǝgwǝnāy. Thus, at that time I bequeathed, without taxation or forced labour, what Lālibālā, lover of God granted. Who will restrain this gwǝlt, be that one excommunicated, amen. This was written upon the request of ʿāqābe saʿāt Maṭāʿ, [named] at birth Yǝrdǝʾanna Krǝstos and at entering monkhood as Ṣaggā Maṭāʿ. Relent that one who requested to write [this] and that one who wrote [this] and bless us, Amen.

ab.seg: To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit.
I, Yǝrdǝʾanna Krǝstos, bǝgwǝnāy of Ṣǝlālā, ‘aqābe sa‘āt of Maṭā‘granted

thirty two fields in Biḥāt, so that Maṭāʿ would beseech a reward for me the Heavenly Kingdom. I granted to Maṭā‘ as an offering what Walda Ma’ǝkali, the owner of the land, gave me agreeing and willing, for he knew that what I took was not by force or violence. If there is anyone who defrauds or usurps Maṭā‘, whether an appointed or whether displaced one, may he be excommunicated, in this world and in the world to come, by the mouth of Maṭā‘ and by the mouth of Jesus Christ. Amen. Let it be, let it be.

In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit.

I, Takaśta Bǝrhān, nabr ʾǝd and ʿaqābe saʿat of Maṭāʿ granted to Maṭāʿ offering of three fields fields in Mikāʾel and fields of ʿOnā below the land of Kǝmǝl ʿAqabā Ḥǝdād in Biḥat . It will come for the monks of Maṭāʿand for ʿaqābe saʿat so that Maṭāʿ beseech a reward for me in the Heavenly Kingdom, while the monks of Maṭāʿ stay in the bridal chamber, while King Yǝkwǝnāt and while liqa ṗāṗāsāt ʾAbbā Qerlos and while sǝyum of ʾƎntartā ʾƎngǝdā ʾƎgziʾ and while sǝyum of Dabra Māʿǝṣo Ḫarāsāy. If someone violates it or if someone defrauds it, may he be excommunicated by the mouth of Maṭāʿ and by the mouth of all holy ones in 454th year of mercy unto the ages of ages, amen and amen.

ab.seg: To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit.

gwǝlt that was granted by King
Yǝkunno ʾAmlak to Danāgǝl, to Beta Masqal and to Beta Māryām, that was violated by sǝyum of Dabra Māʿǝṣo. As for me, I granted it so that it may become gwǝlt for me, for ʾƎngǝdā ʾƎgziʾ. And I have restored and donated to Beta Masqal and to Beta Māryām, and to Danāgǝl, so that God may mercy me through their prayers. I granted, in the manner [other] kings were granting, Saṭo, the land of Alāfo and Der and ʿAd Lǝgāt and Māʿṭawlo and Mǝkmǝs and the land of Mastafā together with Sarḥā and ʿAd Dāʿǝro. Restored I, King Yǝkunno ʾAmlak,while māʾǝkala bāḥr Yāgbā Ṣǝyon, while sǝyum of ʾƎntartā and ʿāqābē ṣanṣan and ḫāsgwā was me, ʾƎngǝdā ʾƎgziʾ, son of Kwǝllu Sagada. And while nǝbura ʾǝd of ʾAksum and ʿāqābē saʿāt of Beta Maṭāʿ Takaśta Bǝrhān and while the Lady of the place Holy Mary. To the one who restored this gwǝlt, may God give him the Heavenly kingdom and may He associate him with the holy ones and martyrs and may He prolong his days on the earth and protect him himself and his wife and his children and his troups unto the ages of ages, amen and amen. Let it be, let it be. If someone violates or defrauds this gwǝlt, may he be excommunicated in front of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit on the heaven and on the earth by the mouth of 15 prophets, by th mouth of 12 apostels and by the mouth of 70 disciples, by the mouth of 318 righteous of faith of ages, amen.

ab.seg: To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit.

I, King
Gabra Masqal, have ascribed, in 512 tear of mercy granted I, King
Gabra Masqal, my royal name [is] Solomon, and I dedicated this gwǝlt to ʾAbbā Maṭāʿ, i.e. Libānos,

And I granted because of the love to Maṭāʿ, so that he would beseech a reward for me in the Heavenly Kingdom and prolong my days on earth. I granted this gwǝlt: in ʾAwegar five villages at Ḥǝṣen and those [at] Biḥat and ʾƎnqarʿo, Qarn ʾOm, Mǝḥbāʾā Mandalt and Mǝgwǝlbǝtā, Galabā and Seset, in Dǝʿduʿ seven villages, in Maraganiyā seven villages, Tadirar ʿAgāmi with its lands where they are. I gave to Maṭāʿ gold and 340 rich vestments and to the holy ones 40 linen and 1000 cows and 20 manasānest and five pans taken from my hip and five pair of shoes from my feet and one cross of gold and one dish of gold and one chalice of gold one chalice of silver, one dish of silver and two dishes of dǝʿm, candles and incense without number and for other churches in his land 30 rich vestments. All this donated I, King
Gabra Masqal, knowing that the wealth of this world will pas and I have heard the word of Ecclesiastes saying, 'Vanity, all is vanity, unless one prepares his provisions beforehead alive'. And I gave to Maṭā‘ and to the holy ones, I, Krǝstos ʾAbuhu to Maṭāʿ of ʾAham as my lord ordered me, [being] sǝyum of ʾƎntartā and māʾǝkala baḥǝr Tǝwāzāt and while ḥasgwā and ʿaqānṣān Bāḥra Sagad son of the king. And under him [is] makwannǝn Krǝstos ʾAbuhu. While ḥedug of ʾƎnbā Sannāyt ʾAyso, while maʾasare nǝgus Kāḥsu Walda Nolāwi and while ʿāqābe saʿāt Maṭāʿ Gabra Krǝstos, son of Barnābās. They made this written, being together in the refuge of gathering, when God gave to
Gabra Masqal in its entirety. And into this gwǝlt that
I granted to ʾAbbā Maṭāʿ, should not interfere neither sǝyum nor displaced one, neither makwannǝn nor someone powerful, nor spokesman of nǝgus, neither a lion or a horse, nor māʾǝkala baḥǝr, neither an ʾawfāri nor a spokesman of ʾawfāri, neither sǝyum of ʾAwegar, nor administrator of ʾAwegar, neither sǝyum of Dabra Māʿǝṣo, nor its ḥǝdug, neither sǝyum of Zaredā or an administrator of Zaredā, neither ʾawfāri of Ḥamāsen, nor ʿaqānṣān of Ḥamāsen. No one should enter Maraganyā, Dǝʿduʿ and Ḥǝṣen, gwǝlts for Maṭāʿ of ʾAham, which granted I, King
Solomon. And there is anyone who violates it or usurps it, may he excommunicated by the mouth of 15 prophets and by the mouth of 12 apostles, by the mouth of 24 priestes of heaven, by 318 righteous in faith and by the mouth of 15 prophets and by the mouth of 12 apostles and by the mouth of Ṗeṭros liqa ṗāṗāsāt, by the prayers of blessed Maṭāʿ, by the mouth of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit may he be excommunicated in this world and in the world that comes, that will not be forgiven through fasting or prayer, through vows or bows unto the ages of ages, amen.

div.ab: To the glory of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit. In 503 year of mercy Yāʿǝbika ʾƎgziʾ granted, so that those who stay in the monastic place may celebrate the commemoration of Maṭāʿ, a gwǝlt of what name is Qarn ʾOm, which has no tribute or obligation, which has no charge or responsibility (tasṭā), which will not expire and has no expiration, where should not enter a horse or an animal, where should not enter sǝyum of Zaredā and ʿaqābe saʿat, no one apart from the children of this place who will celebrate the commemoration of Yāʿǝbika ʾƎgziʾ. And if anyone usurps it or violates it, be it sǝyum of Zaredā or ʿaqābe saʿat, be it makwannǝn or sǝyum of Dabra Māʿǝṣo, be it ḥǝdug or be it baʿaltetu, may he be excommunicated in the heaven and on the earth by the mouth of Ṗeṭros, head of the apostles, by the mouth of 318 righteous of faith, amen. And the one who made it to be written is Yāʿǝbika ʾƎgziʾ of ʾƎnbā Sannāyt, while sǝyum of ʾƎntartā Yāʿǝbika ʾƎgziʾ and Fǝqura ʾƎgziʾ seyum of Dabra Māʿǝṣo, while sǝyum of Zaredā Yāʿǝbika ʾƎgziʾdāy. and while ʿaqābe saʿat of Maṭāʿ ʾAsfǝḥa and the one who translated, Yǝsḥaq, nǝbura ʾǝd of ʾAksum and nǝbura ʾǝd of Dāmǝmo Yāfqǝrana ʾƎgziʾ and ʿaqābe saʿat of Dabra Zayt Tasfā Ṣǝyon. and may He prolong days on the earth for makwannǝn Yāʿǝbika ʾƎgziʾ and may God make him set firmly as the Moon and splendid as the Sun and And on the day of his death, may He count him among the saints and martyrs upon the ages of ages, amen and amen.
